alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 10:01AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following counties, Coahoma, Quitman, Tallahatchie and Yalobusha. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since 7 AM CDT. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charleston, Tutwiler, Webb, Sumner, Paynes, Vance, Dublin, Scobey, Oakland, Glendora, Effie, Tippo, Mikoma, Distall, Waverly, Brazil, Swan Lake, Stover, Albin and Whitehead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
